description: Star Fox 64 is a 3D rail shooter game in which the player controls one of the vehicles piloted by Fox McCloud, usually an Arwing.

v0.1.0.description:
# Changes from the base game

## Misc
* Entering Corneria will set your team's shields to max. This is to prevent a softlock that can occur if Falco is down, but you need to take the Mission Accomplished route.
* If Slippy goes down in Sector X, he will be revived for the next level. This is to prevent Slippy from being bugged until you complete Titania

## Map

To help Star Fox 64 fit into the environment of Archipelago, the map has been changed significantly. When completing a level, you are no longer forced to the next level based on what you did in the previous level. You can also no longer use the `Change Course` or `Retry Course` options on the map. Instead, the map has controls for selecting which level you can go to. The levels available for selection depend on what path items you have received. The map also functions as a sort of in game tracker.

**Controls**

* `D-Pad Right` brings you closer to Venom
* `D-Pad Left` brings you closer to Corneria.
* `D-Pad Up` and `D-Pad Down` change the path from the previous level.

For example, let's assume you have Corneria selected, and have all paths. `D-Pad Right` will select Meteo. From here, `D-Pad Up` will select Sector Y. `D-Pad Left` will select Corneria again.

**Map Legend**

* A colored path means that you have that path as an item. You will be able to take that path when selecting a level.
* An animating Arwing means that you have access to the level, but haven't yet completed the level in a way that would normally take that path.
* A stationary Arwing means that you have completed the level in a way that would normally take that path.

## Locations

* Getting Mission Complete, Mission Accomplished or a level warp.
* Getting a Medal.

## Items

* Paths between levels. You need these to in order to traverse the map.
* Medals. You can require a certain number of Medals before Venom is accessible.
v0.1.0.title: v0.1.0

v0.2.0.description:
# Changes since v0.1.0

* New YAML option `accomplished_sends_complete`:
  * Options are `true` or `false`
  * When set to `true`, getting `Mission Accomplished` on any level will also count as getting `Mission Complete` for that level.
* New `Star Fox 64 Client` command `/autostart`:
  * This command will let you select a program to automatically run every time the client opens.
  * The selected command is saved to your `host.yaml`. Default arguments for this program are also saved there.
  * The program will be launched with any saved arguments (defaults to using the lua) and the path to the patched ROM.
  * For example with default settings: If you use `/autostart` and select EmuHawk.exe, the `Star Fox 64 Client` will open Bizhawk with the patched ROM and lua connector automatically loaded.
  * Using `/autostart` again will disable this behavior.
* The number of `Medals` you have received, along with the number required to enter Venom is now displayed on the map.
* Gray paths on the map are no longer transparent. This makes them much easier to see with certain settings (mainly on console).
* The `Star Fox 64 Client` will now remember the path to the vanilla ROM (saved in `host.yaml`), allowing it to automatically patch when needed.
* Updated the `setup guide` to give more instructions.
* The `setup guide` and `game info` documents will now show on the WebHost.py.
* The Bizhawk connector will now print a helpful message if loaded outside of the Archipelago/data/lua folder.

## Fixes
* When already patched, the path to the patched ROM will now show after the automatic `/help` output, instead of before.
* Fix `await` error in `Star Fox 64 Client` every time a location is sent.
* Increase ping timeout threshold and don't increase ping time during laggy frames.
  * This will help stop the `Unexpected packet: 1` errors.
* The map should more reliably update when receiving new items.
* Fix communication error with EverDrive64 connector.
* Fix `D-Pad Up` and `D-Pad Down` sometimes not working when returning from a level.

## Misc
* Other minor fixes and changes for development.
v0.2.0.title: v0.2.0

v0.2.1.description:
# Changes since v0.2.0

* New client commands:
  * `/patch` - Reruns the patcher.
  * `/rom_path` - Sets (or unsets) the file path of the vanilla ROM used for patching.
  * `/patch_path` - Sets (or unsets) the folder path of where to save the patched ROM.
  * `/program_args` - Sets (or unsets) the arguments to pass to the automatically run program. Defaults to passing the lua to Bizhawk.

## Fixes
* Fixed issues when selecting incorrect ROM for patching.
* If required_medals is 15, shuffle_medals is off and victory_condition is "andross_or_robot_andross", then required_medals will be forced to 14 and a warning will be logged during generation.
* Python v3.10+ should now be compatible
v0.2.1.title: v0.2.1

v0.3.0.description:
# Changes since v0.2.1

* New YAML options:
  * `radio_rando` - Randomize the dialog in the game!
  * `deathlink` - Death Link is now supported! Player deaths are shared with other players who have `deathlink` enabled.
    * A new client command (`/deathlink`) will allow you to toggle Death Link whenever.
  * `ringlink` - Ring Link is also now supported! Your Hit score will be "Ring Linked" with similar "currency" in other compatible games (such as rings in Sonic). Thanks to @mmarsalko for adding this!
    * A new client command (`/ringlink`) will allow you to toggle Ring Link whenever.
  * `default_lives` - Set the number of lives you start with.
  * `medal_*` - An option for every level that allows you to set the score required to get the medal.
* The pause menu now has 2 new options:
  * `Respawn` - Triggers a death, allowing you to restart at a checkpoint... For a price...
  * `Back to Map` - Return to the map without having to complete the level.
    * This allows you to keep items collected before leaving, but your team will also keep damage inflicted...
* The map now has a menu that allows you to heal your team! Press start on the map to use it.
  * For 1 life (Arwing) an ally that you choose will have their ship repaired by 50%.
  * This also allows reviving them if their ship is down.
* The game's state will now be saved and restored when the game is restarted!
  * This includes what scores you got on each level, whether you got the medal, and which members of your team survived.
  * Things like lives, bombs, rings and even laser upgrades are also saved.
  * Story flags are also saved, such as whether the Great Fox was hit by a missile and which members of Star Wolf you defeated on Fortuna.
* Certain events should trigger as they would in vanilla:
  * Bill & Katt will show up in later levels if your path goes through their initial level.
  * The members of Star Wolf you've most recently defeated on Fortuna won't show up on Bolse.
* The game will prevent you from loading in until it has connected to the client, and the client is connected to AP.
* The docs have been updated with the default medal requirements on each level.

## Fixes

* Getting a game over should no longer prevent the game from loading your items, such as paths, when first going back in.
* Venom 1 should now properly reward its medal.
v0.3.0.title: v0.3.0

v0.4.0.description:
# Changes since v0.3.0

* New YAML Options!
  * `level_access` - Choose between `shuffle_levels` or `shuffle_paths`.
    * `shuffle_levels` - Each level will have an item that gets added to the pool. Mission Complete, Accomplished and warps will be checks.
    * `shuffle_paths` - This functions identically to the old YAML option `shuffle_paths` being set to `true`.
    * This option completely replaces the standalone YAML option `shuffle_paths`.
  * `shuffle_starting_level` - If `level_access` is set to `shuffle_levels`, setting this to `true` will randomize which level you start with. `false` makes you start with `Corneria`.
  * `shuffle_checkpoints` - When enabled, the checkpoint rings in levels will be locations and you can't use the checkpoint rings until you receive that level's checkpoint item.
  * `engine_glow` - Customize the color of your engine glow!
  * `radio_rando` - This option was changed to be a choice between `off`, `on` and `on_including_training`. Now you exclude those voiceless dialog boxes!
* Freestanding items are now randomized! Once you collect them, they will revert back to normal the next time you visit the level.
  * It is exclusively the freestanding items that require you to do nothing for them to spawn.
* Uncollected randomized freestanding items and checkpoint rings will be replaced with a custom Archipelago model!
* Items you receive are now displayed on the bottom left in game.
* The required score to get the medal for the level you are on will be shown on the pause menu.
* While on the map, you can press `B` to go back to the main menu.
* The version is now also shown in game on the main menu.
* Added support for `start_inventory_from_pool`.

## Fixes

* Cleaned up how options are displayed on the `WebHost.py`.
* You should now be able to toggle `ringlink` if you had it disabled in your YAML.
* You can no longer select hidden options on the pause menu in training.
* Certain `item_link` options should no longer generate a warning.

Here is a link to [the YAML template](https://github.com/Auztin/AP-Star-Fox-64/blob/v0.4.0/template.yaml) for this version.
v0.4.0.title: v0.4.0

v0.4.1.description:
# Changes since v0.4.0

* New tabs on the AP client:
  * Items - This tab shows all of the items you've received so far. Items that you've received multiple of will be grouped and show how many.
  * Tracker - This tab shows all unchecked locations that are in logic.
    * You can toggle this by using the `/tracker` command.
* Item and Location groups
  * This wasn't correctly implemented in the previous version and caused the apworld to fail a test.

Here is a link to [the YAML template](https://github.com/Auztin/AP-Star-Fox-64/blob/v0.4.1/template.yaml) for this version.
v0.4.1.title: v0.4.1
